### Gitian builds | File | commit b949ac9697a6cfe087f60a16c063ab9c5bf1e81f
(master) | commit 996e3f28e5c6b9905342e2317366bf569514511b
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`a14207517d25fece...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/b949ac9697a6cfe087f60a16c063ab9c5bf1e81f/bitcoin-0.19.99-

Going to restate my understanding just to make sure I'm clear on the logic here:\n\nThe `AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG` macro checks whether a linker flag exists by invoking the linker, and defines failures as when the linker "gives an error", however, warnings are ignored. Since it is possible that when the `AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG` macro invokes the linker with a flag it doesn't understand, the linker only gi

From the `AX_CHECK_LINK_FLAG` [docs](https://www.gnu.org/software/autoconf-archive/ax_check_link_flag.html#ax_check_link_flag):
> Warnings, however, are ignored
>
> If `EXTRA-FLAGS` is defined, it is added to the linkerâ€™s default flags when the check is done. The check is thus made with the flags: "`LDFLAGS EXTRA-FLAGS FLAG`". This can for example be used to force the linker _to issue an err

ACK d333883a0\n\nSo, the semantics of this are different than those of compilation warnings (e.g. `-Wfoo` or `-Werror=bar`) - with compilation warnings flags during configure time we check whether a given flag is supported and if yes, then we use it during make time. With `-Wl,--fatal-warnings`, if it is available, we only append it to the linker flags when checking whether other linker flags li

Thanks for the review.

> This PR omitted the following, I guess on purpose?

Nope. I've added that to configure.ac in the interim, and hadn't updated this PR. Good catch. Have pushed the fix.
re-ACK 03da4c778\n\nMy thought was "this is something Windows-specific, I do not want to know about it"...
Very subtle difference, was about to respond 'these two cases are the same' then noticed `-` versus `--` option prefix :woman_facepalming:
